course_title: Nursing Care for People with Complex Conditions 2

learning_outcomes.description: Explain the role of the registered nurse in a variety of care contexts (e.g., practice nursing, community nursing) that promotes partnering with the client and their family to manage a lifelong complex condition.

Construct an interdisciplinary, evidence-based plan of care for a person with a complex condition that enables flexibility and integration across the health system and recommend strategies for evaluation.
Use core values of palliative care and best available evidence to reflect the individual's values and preferences for care.
Use models of care for people with lifelong and complex conditions to promote collaborative person-centred care.

assessments.task_description:
This assessment will be an off campus, online quiz that uses the Inspera Assessment platform. Students will be required to complete 30 multiple choice questions (MCQ) within the 30 minute timeframe. The MCQ are based on Module 1 of this course ‘Assessing and managing symptoms’ (PCC4U Module 3).

The quiz will only be available in Inspera Assessment from 18/08/2025 at 09:00am and will close on 20/08/2025 at 13:00pm

Students are to refer to the course Blackboard site for additional details related to this assessment.


Laptop

  • For this assessment you will require a laptop that meets the device requirements for Inspera assessments. It is important that you check that your laptop meets the device requirements for using the Inspera Assessment platform and the Inspera Safe Exam Browser. It is important that you prepare your laptop to install SEB. If you do not own a suitable laptop, you can ﾠborrow one from the Library.
  • Find more information about using Inspera Assessment from the Library website.ﾠGet familiar with Inspera, which provides the latest information for students about using Inspera.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The quiz will only be available in Inspera Assessment. Students can commence the quiz within the timeframe but will only have one (1) opportunity to complete the quiz within the timeframe.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.
assessments.late_submission: You will receive a mark of 0 if this assessment is submitted late.
assessments.additional_info: You cannot defer or apply for an extension for this assessment.

assessments.task_description:
This assessment requires you to read and review four (4) case studies and answer the questions related to each case study within a 90-minute timeframe. The cases will address aspects of optimising function in palliative care, chronic kidney disease, dementia and Parkinson's disease. This exam will be completed in-person using Inspera safe exam browser.

Students are to refer to the course Blackboard site for additional details related to this assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The exam will only be available in Inspera Assessment for the duration of your exam. You will not be permitted to click START until directed to do so by your Exam Invigilator.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to defer this exam.
assessments.late_submission: Exams submitted after the end of the submission time will incur a late penalty.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to defer this exam.

assessments.task_description:
Students will select from one of three case studies which portray a client with a chronic condition contextualised within a care episode. Students will develop a plan of care in which the registered nurse leads the interprofessional team in partnership with the client, for a seamless and integrated approach to management of a lifelong condition.

Students are to refer to the course Blackboard site for additional details related to this assessment.
assessments.submission_guidelines: The anti-plagiarism software Turnitin is being used at UQ. The electronic version of your assignment will be submitted via Blackboard, using the Turnitin software. Work submitted will be subjected to a plagiarism detection process. Please refer to ITS help if you experience difficulties in submitting your assessment in Blackboard or using Turnitin.
assessments.deferral_or_extension: You may be able to apply for an extension.
assessments.late_submission: A penalty of 10% of the maximum possible mark will be deducted per 24 hours from time submission is due for up to 7 days. After 7 days, you will receive a mark of 0.
assessments.additional_info: You may be able to apply for an extension.

learning_activities.topic:
Online learning modules

There are five modules in this course. You are expected to spend seven (7) hours per week of online learning for this course, this includes working through the five (5) modules provided. Resources can be found in learning resources on the Blackboard website for this course.
learning_activities.topic_description: Online learning modules There are five modules in this course. You are expected to spend seven (7) hours per week of online learning for this course, this includes working through the five (5) modules provided. Resources can be found in learning resources on the Blackboard website for this course.

learning_activities.learning_period: Multiple weeksFrom Week 1 To Week 4(28 Jul - 24 Aug)
learning_activities.topic:
Tutorials

As this course will run concurrently with clinical placements, tutorials will be held in week 1, week 3 and week 4 as an online option. Preparation for the tutorials is provided in the five learning modules in this course. Students will be expected to interact and engage in group discussions and work through activities to explore interprofessional care practices and the role of the nurse and other health professionals to independently and collaboratively support care of clients with chronic conditions.
